abstract: The slight decline was in line with Wall Street expectations, reassuring investors who feared a repeat of the profit shortfall that sent the conglomerate’s shares tumbling in April.
snippet: The slight decline was in line with Wall Street expectations, reassuring investors who feared a repeat of the profit shortfall that sent the conglomerate’s shares tumbling in April.
lead_paragraph: General Electric reported a slight decline in second-quarter earnings Friday but managed to deliver results that were in line with Wall Street expectations, reassuring investors who feared a repeat of the profit shortfall that sent the giant conglomerate’s stock tumbling in April.

headline.main: G.E. Profit Dips, but Meets Expectations
headline.print_headline: G.E. Profit Dips, but Meets Expectations
